Detailed Description

Internal Use Only: Class to hold a BSD-style socket with accompanying information.



Note that this class does NOT have a copy constructor. This is because the destructor for the class calls close() and because permitting copies may cause consistency problem in the socket interactions.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

Socket* vrt::Socket::accept ( map< string, string > &  options  ) 

Accepts a new TCP client connection.

Parameters:
options Map of options to set (can be null). See top of NetUtilities for details.
Returns:
The new client socket or null if no connection is available within the time set by SO_TIMEOUT.
Exceptions:
VRTException If this is not a TCP_SERVER socket or if an i/o error occurs.
void vrt::Socket::close (  ) 

Closes the socket.

This function is safe to call multiple times.

const string &  host,
int32_t  port,
const string &  device,
map< string, string > &  options,
int32_t  bufLength 
) [static]

Creates a new TCP Server socket.

Parameters:
isOutput Is this socket being created for output (true) or input (false)?
host The host to connect to (null = wildcard address).
port The port number.
device The device to connect to (e.g. "eth0", "eth1.101") (null = use default).
options Map of options to set (can be null). See top of NetUtilities for details.
bufLength The buffer length in bytes.
Returns:
The socket.
Exceptions:
VRTException If an I/O error occurs.

int32_t vrt::Socket::read ( void *  buf,
size_t  len 
) [inline]

Reads data from the socket.

If this is a UDP socket, this will receive a complete datagram (up to the given length) and will return the length. If this is a TCP client socket this will attempt to read in the specified number of octets.

Parameters:
buf The buffer to receive the data. (OUTPUT)
len The length of the buffer.
Returns:
The number of octets received. Returns 0 on a timeout and -1 on EOF.
Exceptions:
VRTException If this is a TCP_SERVER socket or if an i/o error occurs.

References read().

int32_t  len 
)

VRTException If this is a TCP_SERVER socket or if an i/o error occurs.

Referenced by read().

void vrt::Socket::shutdownSocket (  ) 

Stops the socket's i/o but does not close it.

This will stop the low-level socket from receiving any more data, but will still permit reads until the low-level buffers are empty. Following a call to this, a call to read for which there is no data will return EOF rather than 0.

virtual string vrt::Socket::toString (  )  const [virtual]

int32_t vrt::Socket::write ( const void *  buf,
size_t  len 
) [inline]

Writes data to the socket.

If this is a UDP socket, this will transmit a complete datagram. If this is a TCP client socket this will write the data to the stream.

Parameters:
buf The buffer to receive the data. (INPUT)
len The length of the buffer.
Returns:
The number of octets sent. Returns 0 on a timeout and -1 on EOF.
Exceptions:
VRTException If this is a TCP_SERVER socket or if an i/o error occurs.

References write().
